Namespace: reservedIp

reservedIp

Methods for interacting with the Reserved IP endpoints
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 1

Methods

attach(parameters)

Attach a reserved IP from an existing subscription.
This feature operates normally when networking conditions are stable, but it is not reliable for conditions when high availability is needed.
For HA, see our High Availability on Vultr with Floating IP and BGP guide.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip_attach
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
ip_address string Reserved IP to be attached. Include the subnet size in this parameter (e.g: /32 or /64).
attach_SUBID number Unique identifier of the target server.
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 131

convert(parameters)

Convert an existing IP on a subscription to a reserved IP. Returns the SUBID of the newly created reserved IP.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip_convert
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
SUBID number SUBID of the server that currently has the IP address you want to convert.
ip_address string IP address you want to convert (v4 must be a /32, v6 must be a /64).
label string <optional>
 Label for this reserved IP
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 69

create(parameters)

Create a new reserved IP. Reserved IPs can only be used within the same datacenter for which they were created.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip_create
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Attributes Description
DCID number Location to create this reserved IP in.
ip_type string 'v4' or 'v6' Type of reserved IP to create.
label string <optional>
 Label for this reserved IP.
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 100

delete(parameters)

Remove a reserved IP from your account. After making this call, you will not be able to recover the IP address.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip_destroy
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
ip_address string Reserved IP to remove from your account.
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 20

detach(parameters)

Detach a reserved IP from an existing subscription.
This feature operates normally when networking conditions are stable, but it is not reliable for conditions when high availability is needed.
For HA, see our High Availability on Vultr with Floating IP and BGP guide.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip_detach
Parameters:
Name Type Description
parameters object
Properties
Name Type Description
ip_address string Reserved IP to be detached. Include the subnet size in this parameter (e.g: /32 or /64).
detach_SUBID number Unique identifier of the target server.
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 41

list()

List all the active reserved IPs on this account. The "subnet_size" field is the size of the network assigned to this subscription. This will typically be a /64 for IPv6, or a /32 for IPv4.
https://www.vultr.com/api/#reservedip_ip_list
Source:
  • reserved-ip.js, line 7
